Reviews.Title: Not what it seems
Reviews.Author: bdj108
Reviews.Content: I thought this phone would work directly with my WIFI as I want to have access to skype without having to have my computer on all of the time.  This phone basically works with a wireless connection (with a USB Dongle that is included) that is from your computer.  So no computer on, no skype.  It is quite useless.  Also once you are about 5 meters or 15 feet from your computer the signal drops.

Reviews.Title: Not much value
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: Well, there is no driver/software for anything other than Windows XP, and it does not seem to work at all with Skype-perhaps it would work with an earlier version of Skype.  Essentially worthless.

Reviews.Title: Unable to use this phone
Reviews.Author: Ed Howlett
Reviews.Content: There is no upgrade for Windows 7 or 8 for this phone. I had to return it for this reason.

Reviews.Title: does not work with Macintosh
Reviews.Author: Alan Timothy Lunceford
Reviews.Content: This is not a stand alone SKYPE Phone. It has to be hooked up to a PC. It did not work for me but it might work for you with a PC. SKYPE is great.

Reviews.Title: New "old" internet phone.
Reviews.Author: Daniel F. Cole
Reviews.Content: Obsolete technology, but usable and cheap. It requires a subscription to call anywhere or another skype phone on a computer somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: bad quality
Reviews.Author: Donald Watkins
Reviews.Content: not very good quality, sound is poor, has trouble connecting, Do not reconmend to anyone who truly uses a home phone

Reviews.Title: Worst purchase - don't buy
Reviews.Author: Michael Shader
Reviews.Content: It only works through the computer, the WiFi isn't recognized  and doesn't work that well at all. You will be making a mistakeif you purchase this item.

Reviews.Title: Not working well
Reviews.Author: Martin Obando
Reviews.Content: Not working well i tried in windows xp and detete all cantacts from my account in skype i wold like to received my money back

Reviews.Title: ASUS AiGuru S2 Wireless-G Skype Phone w/Windows SideShow, Windows Media...
Reviews.Author: bill bigg
Reviews.Content: ASUS AiGuru S2 Wireless-G Skype Phone w/Windows SideShow, Windows Media...well worth the price the included wi fi adapter alone is worth it

Reviews.Title: NO LONGER SUPPOERTED BY SKYPE
Reviews.Author: sasquatch
Reviews.Content: Obsolete. As of November 2013, this is a paperweight. Skype software no longer recognizes it. And that's that. Over and out

Reviews.Title: Poorman's Skype Wi-Fi phone
Reviews.Author: Vermont Avenue
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the negative comments, it does the jobs it claims and more.  It's brand new and looks sleek as far as the phone unit and the wireless adapter.  The engineers put in a lot of thoughts into the unit.  The unit is so neat.  The wireless adapter has flexible standing up steel strand extension cord, one that I haven't seen before.  I know it does not have all the luxuries of expensive phones, but for $13.99 including shipping it is a poor man's dream Skype Wi-Fi phone.

Reviews.Title: SUS AiGuru S2 Wireless-G Skype Phone
Reviews.Author: JUAN
Reviews.Content: No way to use it with WI-FI, the signal is full but the phone disconnected each 2 or 3 minutes, and I was 8 ft. from the dongle that send the signal, my computer do not have the last USB version and that can be the reason for the dongle failure. I tried to use it connecting direct to the USB with cable provided, no dongle, and it is working OK. A problem is that I can not dial a number from the phone, I can dial only to the contacts that were registered in the computer, that is, if I want to call a friend from the phone, I must register it in the computer previously, and then it appears always in the phone. Another problem, it is not possible to use it if the user is a Microsoft user with the @, that is  xx@hotmail.com in example, and must be a SKYPE user account. I paid US$ 10 each, I bought two units, and for that money it is a good buy. A  w/Windows SideShow, Windows Media Player & iTunes Support
